Uses of Class
betsy.grammar.WordTree

  • Packages that use WordTree 
    Package Description
    betsy.grammar
    Has classes used for interpreting the grammar of a sentence, the meanings of words or phrases in a sentence, and for reconstructing sentences.
    betsy.memory
    Has classes used by Betsy to remember facts and hold a conversation.

    • Uses of WordTree in betsy.grammar

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      WordTree<T> WordTree.addChild(WordTree<T> tree)
      Add the given tree to this tree's children.
      WordTree<T> WordTree.clone()
      Create a full copy of this tree, its children, their children, etc.
      static WordTree<Tag> Tag.fromTree(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree t)
      From an edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree, create a WordTree of Tags, converting the Penn Treebank acronyms used in the Tree to tags

      Get the child at the specific index.
      WordTree<T> WordTree.getLeaf(T type, java.lang.String word)
      Find the first direct child of this tree meeting the criteria described in hasLeaf().
      WordTree<T> WordTree.getParent()
      Get the "parent" of this WordTree - the tree that contains this tree as a child.
      WordTree<T> WordTree.getType(T type)
      Get the first direct child of this tree with the specified type.
      WordTree<T> WordTree.insertTree(WordTree<T> tree)

      Generate a WordTree of StructureTags, given a tree of Tags parsed from a sentence.

      WordTree<StructureTag> Context.getContextFromPronoun(java.lang.String pronoun)
      Given a pronoun word (he, she, they, it, etc.), get the noun-phrase, based on the user's recent sentences, most likely meant by it.
      WordTree<StructureTag> Context.getHer()
      Get the phrase that the word "her" most likely refers to.
      WordTree<StructureTag> Context.getHim()
      Get the phrase that the word "him" most likely refers to.
      WordTree<StructureTag> Context.getIt()
      Get the phrase that the word "it" most likely refers to.
      WordTree<StructureTag> Context.getThem()
      Get the phrase that the word "them" most likely refers to.
